meanings.def: that is neither very good, large, hot, etc. nor very bad, small, cold, etc.
examples: Even moderate amounts of the drug can be fatal.
The team enjoyed only moderate success last season.

meanings.def: having or showing opinions, especially about politics, that are not extreme
staying within limits that are considered to be reasonable by most people
to become or make something become less extreme, severe, etc.
examples: By evening the wind had moderated slightly.
moderate something We agreed to moderate our original demands.
She apologized immediately and moderated her voice.

meanings.def: to check that an exam has been marked fairly and in the same way by different people
to be in charge of a discussion or debate and make sure it is fair
examples: The television debate was moderated by a law professor.

meanings.def: to be responsible for preventing offensive material from being published on a website; to remove offensive material from a website
examples: Comments on this article will be moderated.

meanings.def: a person who has opinions, especially about politics, that are not extreme
